plugin.commands.name: quickSearch
plugin.commands.description: quick Search over all notes, showing results in a fixed Quick Search results note

plugin.commands.name: saveSearch
plugin.commands.description: Save results from a search over all notes

plugin.commands.name: saveSearchInPeriod
plugin.commands.description: Save results from a search of specified tags or mentions over Calendar notes from a time period
arguments: start date to search over (YYYYMMDD or YYYY-MM-DD). If not given, then defaults to 3 months ago
end date to search over (YYYYMMDD or YYYY-MM-DD). If not given, then defaults to today

plugin.commands.name: saveSearchOverCalendar
plugin.commands.description: Save results from a search of specified tags or mentions over all Calendar notes

plugin.commands.name: saveSearchOverNotes
plugin.commands.description: Save results from a search over all project notes

plugin.settings.title: Automatically save
plugin.settings.description: If true, will save to an automatically-named note in the configured folder, starting with the search terms.

plugin.settings.title: Folder name
plugin.settings.description: Folder to store any output files in

plugin.settings.title: Folders to exclude
plugin.settings.description: List of folders to exclude in these commands. May be empty. (Note that @Trash, @Templates and @Archive are always excluded.)

plugin.settings.title: Heading level
plugin.settings.description: Heading level (1-5) to use when writing output to notes

plugin.settings.title: Default Search terms
plugin.settings.description: Optional list of search terms to use by default. If empty, you will be asked for terms each time you run the command.

plugin.settings.title: Saved Search heading
plugin.settings.description: Text to append to headings in search results (optional)

plugin.settings.title: Group results by Note?
plugin.settings.description: This controls how results are displayed. If true, matches found within the same note are grouped together. If false, every match is shown with a note link at the end of the match.

plugin.settings.title: Sort order for results
plugin.settings.description: This controls the order that the results are displayed. Please choose from one of the options.

plugin.settings.title: Prefix for search result lines
plugin.settings.description: String to put at the start of each search result line. Default is '- '. Can also be empty.

plugin.settings.title: Result quote length
plugin.settings.description: Length of matching line to quote in the search results. To always quote the full line set this to 0.

plugin.settings.todo: TODO: hopefully change this in time
plugin.settings.title: Match case when searching?
plugin.settings.description: Do searches match case (capitalisation) or not?

plugin.settings.title: Highlight matching search terms?
plugin.settings.description: Whether to use ==highlight== of matched occurrences in output. (Works best when using a theme with highlighting.)

plugin.settings.title: Show empty matches?
plugin.settings.description: If no matches of the search term(s) are found, setting this true will still show a heading for the term(s)

plugin.settings.title: Date style
plugin.settings.description: Where the context for a match is a date, does it get shown as a 'date' using your locale, or as a NP date 'link' ([[2022-06-30]]), `at` (`@2022-06-30`), 'date' (date formatted for your locale, or 'scheduled' (`>2022-06-30`).
